Untitled 1.text: According to the medieval Franciscan philosopher and theologian Peter Auriol (c. 1280-1322), our sensory powers play an active role in perception.

Untitled 2.text: Auriol's proposes a kind of direct realist theory of perception, without the use of mediation as proposed by representationalism.

Untitled 3.text: Auriol's account of perception is based on the conviction that the sensory faculty is active. It produces the apparent being of the object perceived and does so according to the information encoded in the similitude.
